page.title: 06SHOPPING
page.content: A recent development in Renfrew has beeen the opening up of a number of large supermarkets which has had an adverse effect on the small traders in the area. A number of small corner shops have closed as a result. The supermarkets have ,however, created employment particularly for young people. Presto is a large store in the centre of town occupying an excellent site at the Cross. Tesco, a much larger store, was built on the site of the old Renfrew Airport and very close to the M8 motorway which increases its catchment area. The other development has been the growth of 'take away' food shops, especially Italian and Indian, but the traditional 'Chippie' (Fish and Chip shop) retains its popularity. There are no department stores because of low population. The nearest large shopping area is Paisley
